data.title: Unable to compile HEAD on Mac OS X
data.body:
Compiling latest HEAD version (commit c2e2f2e0ae) on Mac OS X, I get the following error message:

```
g++ -o drivers/unix/os_unix.osx.tools.64.o -c -g3 -Wall -DDEBUG_ENABLED -DDEBUG_MEMORY_ENABLED -DFREETYPE_ENABLED -arch x86_64 -DDEBUG_MEMORY_ALLOC -DSCI_NAMESPACE -DAPPLE_STYLE_KEYS -DUNIX_ENABLED -DGLES2_ENABLED -DGLEW_ENABLED -DOSX_ENABLED -DMUSEPACK_ENABLED -DSQUISH_ENABLED -DVORBIS_ENABLED -DTHEORA_ENABLED -DPNG_ENABLED -DDDS_ENABLED -DPVR_ENABLED -DJPG_ENABLED -DWEBP_ENABLED -DSPEEX_ENABLED -DTOOLS_ENABLED -DGDSCRIPT_ENABLED -DMINIZIP_ENABLED -DXML_ENABLED -DETC1_ENABLED -Icore -Icore/math -Itools -Idrivers -I. -Iplatform/osx -Itools/freetype -Itools/freetype/freetype/include -Idrivers/unix/vorbis drivers/unix/os_unix.cpp
drivers/unix/os_unix.cpp:229:2: error: no matching function for call to 'localtime'
        localtime(&tv_now.tv_usec);
        ^~~~~~~~~
/usr/include/time.h:112:12: note: candidate function not viable: no known conversion from '__darwin_suseconds_t *'
      (aka 'int *') to 'const time_t *' (aka 'const long *') for 1st argument
struct tm *localtime(const time_t *);
           ^
1 error generated.
scons: *** [drivers/unix/os_unix.osx.tools.64.o] Error 1
scons: building terminated because of errors.
```

data.title: 2D Platformer demo - one-way platform malfunctions
data.body: https://youtu.be/GOQqWtPViDA

data.title: Add missing signal token name
data.body:
TK_PR_SIGNAL name was missing in token_names since 48f1d02 which caused TK_CURSOR to exceed the size of the array.

closes #2201

data.title: Gridmap lighting is screwed up in 3D Platformer demo
data.body:
x86_64 Gentoo, muxless hybrid Intel and AMD graphics, using integrated GPU.

The 3D platformer demo's gridmap appears totally black except for specular reflections. Everything else looks okay.

data.title: Shader glitch when using stretch_mode=VIEWPORT
data.body:
![shader_glitch](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6296184/9124022/f3e0e310-3c69-11e5-97f2-f438b185e637.png)

When using the stretch mode "viewport" and stretching the screen, the shader fails and shows some weird glitch on the screen instead.

I also noticed that some UI elements gets chopped in half or doesn't show at all (inputs still work).
You can test this issue in the demo "screen_space_shaders" and changing the stretch mode to viewport.

PS: this also happens in android. It's not priority but it would be great to have fixed.

data.title: Add OS.get_system_time_msec
data.body: Returns the current (local) milliseconds of the system's time.

data.title: Small animation editor and bones improvements
data.body:
This is an issue for small anim editor improvements. After working for quite some time with it following issues appeared for me.
1. It would be nice to move the timeline cursor beyond the animation lenght. Preferable would be a toggle button which can release the cursor or keep it within the limits. Sometimes it is nice to duplicate keyframes beyond the timeline.
   2.Imho it would be good if we just see the node name with pos,loc,rot and not the complete path to the node. Often you cannot see which keys you are editing, because the path is so long. If then pressing on the name you could edit the whole path.
2. There is the clear pose operator. But it is useless for a character because the default pos is at 0,0 scale is at 1,1 and rot at 0. Would be nice if we can define an anim as default pose which this function will use as reference for clearing the pose.
3. I wish we can hide Bone Armatures. Maybe add is as a function into the skeleton menu.
4. Coloring Bones would be awesome too.
5. adding IK with reference bones would be great! So we can for example move the upper body and the feet will always stay at its place
6. constraint bone width to viewport zoom. Currently the width is absolute, which can result in very fat bones when zooming out, so you the character is hardly to see.

data.title: Add editor setting to use raw (0 to 1) or 255 color range values by default
data.body: A reminder to implement - for @reduz

data.title: Live Edit and dockable game window
data.body:
since we have a live edit, would be a nice ideia that we can dock the game window in the editor window, so we don't need to do alt+tab or two screens...
Also, since i am on the docking topic i would like to be able to undock the script and debug window, it would be useful to the ones with two screens (not my case, but still would be good)

data.title: godot osx font too small [字体太小了]
data.body: i create godot with my macbook retina , but the font too small ,how can i setting up?

data.title: Concave CollisionPolygon2D is split with gaps
data.body:
![bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10054853/9083799/e47a8a7c-3b9f-11e5-8c7e-5fbfa9bffd69.gif)
![bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10054853/9083824/10f2fabc-3ba0-11e5-9bb1-12876597ea13.gif)

the shape will be split,but some time it will generate a gap and other collision shapes will not collide with this gap.

data.title: Impossible to resize elements in Editor - console reports Edit CanvasItem
data.body:
I have difficulties to reproduce, but when working with GraphNodes, at a certain moment it is impossible to edit any element of the scene.
A left mouse click anywhere (even in the void) in the 2D editor has no effect on selection/deselection. Output shows only "Edit CanvasItem" when clicking anywhere.
However, moving the last selected element is possible.
Handles at every corner and side of the element are not shown.
Modifying properties of elements work if they are selected from the Scene Tree.

data.title: Request: possibility that Particles2D/Particles can emit scene
data.body:
I think about:
- particle with collision
- with behaviors
- particles emitting particles node (fireworks!!)

and many more.

data.title: Autocompletion can fail to work
data.body: For some objects auto completion does not work sometimes. Would be great if autocompletion would work for all referenced objects.

data.title: Bracket closing for auto completion
data.body:
If you want to write a function into closed brackets () you endup with something like that if you use auto completion:
(function_name()

Would be nice if it keeps the outer bracket like that:
(function_name())

data.title: Convert To Tileset doesn't keep Collisions informations
data.body:
While following [this tutorial](http://www.gamefromscratch.com/post/2015/04/28/Godot-Engine-Tutorial-Part-8-Tilemaps.aspx), I came accross the same issue the author mentions about the TileSet converter.

If you prepare tiles with collision informations, then convert the scene to a tileset and use it in a TileMap node in a new scene, collision informations are lost.
You can check that by opening the generated xml file. Here is a [sample xml file](http://pastebin.com/LUWF1kEQ).

I've tested this feature on v1.1.stable.d3b42e41b0, on Debian Jessie, 32bits and 64 bits version, and the issue remains the same.

data.title: ParallaxBackground: added option to ignore camera zoom
data.body:
Fixes issue #2045 

It's not a definitive solution, but it's serves well as a workaround to work with parallax backgrounds.
PD: here's a test project https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/274954519/parallax-test.zip

data.title: android not finding compiled GD script
data.body:
When I export a simple game to an android template with GDScripts set to compile, logcat spits out that it can't load any of the script resources.

if I tell the export to not compile GDScripts, script resources load just fine on android.

data.title: Fix vorbis seek_pos
data.body: Without this, seeking mostly only works if input is 0. Old library must have used milliseconds instead of seconds.

data.title: Inconsistent quit notification when frame limit is off
data.body:
Mind you this apparently only works on certain hardware, possibly low-end. 

When my 'target_fps' option is turned off, the quit notification does not always trigger. Maybe 1/3 of the time it works. It does not even enter the function because it does not give a '7' for the notification when I press the close button.

It is a medium size program and I followed this tutorial to the exact: https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/wiki/tutorial_quit  so there is little need to share code. It does not get past the conditional when it doesn't work.

I had romulox look at it and it works consistently on his computer. It is possible our hardware difference (his computer is much better) is causing the difference, but I am not certain. 
romulox_x: i took out the tree.quit line so i could click the x a bunch, and it prints every time

data.title: More editor window flexibility
data.body:
Add the possibility to dock 2d, 3d, script and help taps separately,
so we can view them at same time, especially with the new live scene editing feature.

data.title: No way to programmatically inspect signal connections from script
data.body:
This would be pretty useful for tools and plugins.  I see there's an `Object::_get_signal_connection_list` alongside `Object::_get_signal_list`, but it's not exposed to script.

Also, both of them just return an empty array  :)

data.title: preload bug
data.body:
Windows 7  Godot 1.1 custom build (5 July)

I don't know if it happens with load function too, but, when we have a file i.e. "texture.png" and we want to preload this in this way:  preload("res://texture.png")  everything is okay, but if we try  preload("res://Texture.png") in editor will be everything ok, but after export to exe that file is not loaded.

data.title: add flag and multiline hints in GDScript
data.body:
`export (flag) var test` for PROPERTY_HINT_ALL_FLAGS
`export (multiline) var test` for PROPERTY_HINT_MULTILINE_TEXT

data.title: "Quit to project list" sometimes triggers playing the project instead of showing the project list
data.body: While using "quit to project list" in the scene menu,sometimes It will cause play the project.It only happens in godot x64.

data.title: "Delete" key in SampleLibrary editor deleted SamplePlayer instead of highlighted sample
data.body:
As shown in the following screenshot:
![delete](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/8989535/0e1aaa2c-36ed-11e5-9c52-a9b705a583cd.jpg)

When pressing the "Delete" key of the keyboard after selecting the "respawn1" sample, it's the "SamplePlayer" from the scene menu which gets deleted, instead of the intended single sample.

Hopefully it comes back with Ctrl+Z, but still :)

data.title: Loading resources from user://
data.body:
( Win7, 1.1stable )
At the moment you can't load resources from user:// path. Saving using ResourceSaver works fine.
ResourceLoader seem to always add "res://" before given path:

```
load("user://test.png") # existing resource

ERROR:  Failed loading image: res://user://test.png
At:  scene/io/resource_format_image.cpp:114
ERROR:  Failed loading image for BitMap: res://user://test.png
At:  scene/resources/bit_mask.cpp:219
ERROR:  Failed loading resource: user://test.png
At:  core/io/resource_loader.cpp:209
```

Are there some reasons for it to not work, or it's a bug?

data.title: Casting of Variant to double loses precision
data.body:
In GDScript I have:

```
   dc['batman']=3.1415
```

I try to store it using a module:

```
  case Variant::REAL:
            sqlite3_bind_double(stmt, i, (double) *value);
            break;
```

Storede in database the value is:

```
  3.1414999961853
```

In geometry it can be inexpressive.
If I use it to store money of a character it will be sad.

data.title: Can't use JOYSTICK_MOTION in InputMap.action_add_event
data.body:
I want to add analog button to InputMap for control UI with joystick

For keyboard and joystick button it work fine but joystick motion is not.

```
    InputMap.erase_action("ui_up")
    InputMap.add_action("ui_up")

    # Keyboard
    var event = InputEvent()
    event.type = InputEvent.KEY
    event.scancode = KEY_UP
    InputMap.action_add_event("ui_up", event)

    # Joystick button
    event = InputEvent()
    event.type = InputEvent.JOYSTICK_BUTTON
    event.device = 0
    event.button_index = 0
    InputMap.action_add_event("ui_up", event)

    # Joystick motion
    event = InputEvent()
    event.type = InputEvent.JOYSTICK_MOTION
    event.device = 0
    event.axis = 1
    event.value = -1
    InputMap.action_add_event("ui_up", event)
```

I resolve it by send InputEvent when want to press ation key

```
    var event = InputEvent()
    event.set_as_action("ui_down", true)
    OS.get_main_loop().input_event(event)
```

Yes, it has a condition, when stay key press it not work fine (In normal situation it will smooth shift ui).
